title: Flim the BBs - This Is a Recording (1992)@320kbps RESEED
description:
MP3/320kbps

Flim & the BB&#039;s are a contemporary jazz band that formed in the late seventies and are the first jazz band to appear on compact disc. The band&#039;s name comes from the nickname of Jimmy Johnson and the initials of the other two members, Bill Berg and Billy Barber (Dick Oatts, a woodwind player, would join the group in 1984.) They are most notable for the 90&#039;s theme song to the American soap opera All My Children and for making one of the first all-digital recordings in 1978 (though the prototype machine which was used was the only machine able to read the master tape.) The band, with Johnson&#039;s pioneering five-string bass from Alembic, went on to create five critically acclaimed albums for DMP Records before signing with Warner Bros. Records.
